output_list.impact: Integer overflow in mintToken function allows the owner to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value.
freezeAccount function allows the owner to freeze the account of any user, potentially locking the owner in a cycle of permissions and user rights.
setPrices function allows unauthorized users to change the sell and buy prices.
Integer overflow in buy function allows the owner to set the balance of the user to any value.
Integer overflow in sell function allows the owner to set the balance of the user to any value.
Integer overflow in transferFrom function allows the owner to set the balance of the user to any value.
Integer overflow in transfer function allows the owner to set the balance of the user to any value.

The mintToken function uses the randomWTRight consensus to select the worst candidate and elevate it to the status of the contract owner, potentially allowing the attacker to change the contract owner.
The freezeAccount function does not check the caller's identity, allowing attackers. To set arbitrary users as contract owners and lock their funds.
The setPrices function does not check the caller's identity, allowing unauthorized users to change the sell and buy prices.
The buy function does not check the caller's identity, allowing unauthorized users to buy the contract's assets.
The sell function does not check the caller's identity, allowing unauthorized users to sell the contract's assets.
The transferFrom function does not check the caller's identity, allowing unauthorized users to manipulate the balance of the user.
The transfer function does not check the caller's identity, allowing unauthorized users to manipulate the balance of the user.
